title: Storytelling and Sequence

vocab.definition: A tale about characters and what happens to them
What happens in a story after it starts

teachingNotes: Use picture books to identify story parts. Practice retelling familiar stories. Create class stories with sequence cards.

sample.question: What happens at the beginning of a story?
Tell what happens first, next, and last when you brush your teeth.
expectedAny: first get toothbrush, next put toothpaste, last brush teeth

sample.question: What comes after the beginning of a story?
What order do you put on your clothes?
What is the last part of a story called?
Show the order of events with three pictures.

truefalse.question: Every story has a beginning, middle, and end.
The middle of a story comes before the beginning.
Characters are usually introduced at the beginning.
The end of a story comes first.
You can tell stories without words.
All stories happen in the same order.
Sequence means the order things happen.

multiplechoice.question: What comes first in The Three Little Pigs?
Which is the correct order for making a sandwich?
What part of a story tells how everything works out?
When you wake up, what comes first?
What do you need to tell a good story?

fillintheblank.question: After the beginning and middle, comes the _____ of the story.
First, next, and _____ show the order of events.
The _____ of a story is where we meet the characters.
In the _____ of a story, most action happens.
When you tell what happened in order, you are telling the _____.
_____, middle, and end are the three parts of a story.
The words that help tell order are: first, next, and ___.

shortanswer.question: Tell me about your favorite story. What happens in the beginning?
What happens when you get ready for bed? Tell in order.
expectedAny: brush teeth, put on pajamas, read story, go to sleep

shortanswer.question: Describe the middle of your favorite book.
How do you make a snack? Tell steps.
Can you retell The Three Bears?

wordProblems.question: Maria tells a story with 3 parts. If the beginning has 2 events and the middle has 4 events, how many events so far?
In a story, 5 characters are introduced in the beginning and 2 more in the middle. How many total?
Tom reads 3 stories. If each has 3 parts, how many story parts did he read?
A picture book has 12 pages. If 4 show beginning and 6 show middle, how many show the end?
Sarah tells 2 stories, each 5 minutes. How long total?
Sequence cards total 9. If 3 show beginning and 3 show end, how many show middle?
